intro: Hibbertia squarrosa, commonly known as the squarrosa coral tree, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It is characterized by its striking yellow-orange flowers and distinctive, often hairy, foliage. The plant is a member of the Dilleniaceae family and typically grows in coastal and sandy soils. Hibbertia squarrosa is known for its ability to thrive in well-drained conditions and full sun. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscaping.
